tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE streetlight_sensors (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  streetlight_id INT,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  reading_time TIMESTAMP,
  luminosity FLOAT,
  motion_detected BOOL
);

CREATE TABLE smart_streetlights (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_type VARCHAR(20),
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    streetlight_id INT,
    energy_usage FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (streetlight_id) REFERENCES smart_streetlights(id)
);

CREATE TABLE Streetlights (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  light_id INT,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  light_level INT,
  power_consumption INT
);

CREATE TABLE LightEvents (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  light_id INT,
  event_type VARCHAR(50),
  event_time TIMESTAMP,
  event_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyConsumption (
  consumption_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  light_id INT,
  consumption_date DATE,
  consumption_kwh DECIMAL(10, 2),
  consumption_cost DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE smart_streetlights (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_data JSON,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE light_settings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    streetlight_id INT,
    brightness INT,
    schedule VARCHAR(100),
    CONSTRAINT fk_streetlight_id FOREIGN KEY (streetlight_id) REFERENCES smart_streetlights(id)
);

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    streetlight_id INT,
    energy_consumed FLOAT,
    date DATE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_light_id FOREIGN KEY (streetlight_id) REFERENCES smart_streetlights(id)
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    streetlight_id INT,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    maintenance_details TEXT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_light_id FOREIGN KEY (streetlight_id) REFERENCES smart_streetlights(id)
);

CREATE TABLE streetlights (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  sensor_id INT,
  wattage INT,
  energy_consumed DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE sensors (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  manufacturer VARCHAR(100),
  installation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE power_consumption (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  power_consumed DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE energy_optimization (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  optimization_strategy TEXT,
  last_optimization_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
  maintenance_date DATE
)
